author: Christophe Fergeau
message:
Given your last paragraph, I'm not sure what the whole point of this is...
dist:
git archive --prefix=mysoftware-$version . | bzip2
would be much easier (no need to create another clone, ...)

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: Wow, I didn't know about "git archive", thanks for this! Does anyone know a bzr equivalent?

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message:
Answering myself, the bzr equivalent is "bzr export":

bzr export --root=mysoftware-$version mysoftware-$version.tar.bz2

author: Denis Arnaud (@denis_arnaud)
message:
Note that it is safer to replace "/build/" by "${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}". Hence, it gives:
set(CPACK_SOURCE_IGNORE_FILES
"${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR};/.bzr/;~$;${CPACK_SOURCE_IGNORE_FILES}")

Indeed, if by any chance your username happens to be 'build' (the one I precisely use to package for Linux distributions), the tar-ball will be almost empty otherwise...

replies.author: Ash
replies.message: Do not forget the leading shash "${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/;..." if you do not want omit directories like builder, building etc. too.
